sense.name: state of nervous excitement
sense.examples: Mary's agitation increased as the child behind her kept kicking her seat. I detected agitation in his voice at the meeting. Sally soothed the cat's agitations by stroking its fur.

sense.name: a social state of unrest, political turmoil
sense.examples: There has been widespread agitation in the street over his arrest. What was all that agitation about last night in the front lobby?

sense.name: activity of churning, stirring brskly
sense.commentary: AGITATION[+activity][+churn][+briskly][+liquid] Note: nominalization - the wind's agitation of the water -> the wind agitated the water
sense.examples: The agitation of the clothes in the washing machine helps clean them. How many agitations per minute does this machine perform? The agitation of the egg whites incorporates air into them, making them fluffy. The agitation of the surface of the sea was caused by strong winds.

sense.name: cause turmoil, excitement
sense.commentary: AGITATION[+activity][+cause][+turmoil] Note: nominalization - the agitation by the scabs -> the scabs agitated X
sense.examples: The agitation of the strikers by the scabs was unfortunate. The agitation of his remarks surprised John. (surprised people were agitated by them)
